thread.title: Large turnout in Goa, Punjab assembly polls: EC | The Indian Express
thread.title_full: Large turnout in Goa, Punjab assembly polls: EC | The Indian Express

title: Large turnout in Goa, Punjab assembly polls: EC | The Indian Express
text:
Large turnout in Goa, Punjab assembly polls: EC Large turnout in Goa, Punjab assembly polls: EC In Goa, the final voter turnout recorded in the 2012 assembly polls was 81.8 per cent. By: PTI | New Delhi | Published:February 4, 2017 9:12 pm One case of violence reported which took place in Lalu Ghuman village in Tarn Taran, said Deputy election commissioner Sandeep Saxena (Source: ANI) 
Goa and Punjab on Saturday witnessed peaceful assembly elections with the former clocking a record 83 per cent voter turnout and the latter 70 per cent which the Election Commission said was set to increase when the final figures come in. While Goa’s voter turnout is the biggest ever, Punjab’s polling percentage is lower as compared to the 2012 assembly polls and the 2014 Lok Sabha elections. 
In Goa, the final voter turnout recorded in the 2012 assembly polls was 81.8 per cent. It was 70.5 per cent in 2007. In Punjab, it was 78.06 per cent in 2012 assembly polls and 70.89 per cent in the Lok Sabha elections of 2014. Responding to questions on failure of EVMs in Punjab, Deputy Election Commissioner Sandeep Saxena said out of 22,167 machines deployed, only 47 malfunctioned and were replaced. He said the failure rate was 0.2 per cent which was well within the accepted figures of 1 to 3 per cent. 
ALSO READ: Goa sees highest voter turnout at 83%; Punjab sees 75% polling, clashes reported 
Out of the nearly 66,000 voter-verified paper audit trail (VVPAT) machines, 187 malfunctioned, Saxena said adding that the failure rate was 2.8 per cent. While the elections went off peacefully in the two states, a clash between supporters of two parties was reported from Lalu Guman village in Taran Taran around 3.15 pm in which one person was shot at.
